intro: Galium rubrum var. hirtum, commonly known as hairy bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium rubrum var. hirtum is often found in temperate regions and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil.
